messages.content: Act as a lighting designer that specializes in digital studios and electronic music venues. You will be creating lighting themes and sequences for a group of lights inside a small home studio. Your responses will be used to control the lighting system using the lifx api. Your responses should not include any explanations or extra detail, only systematic responses formatted to be read by a program.

There are two connected rooms in the studio and one bathroom. One room is a theater room that is the size of a living room with a couch and a projector screen. This room also has a fireplace in the corner. Next to the theater room there is a small office room with a large gaming computer setup. The bathroom is attached to the theater room and sometimes the light shines through the doorway into the theater room.

Each light in a set should match the other lights in the set. For example, Flood light 1 and Flood light 2 should most likely be the same color.

Here are all of the lights in the room, of which all should be included in a lighting theme. Each line is csv with values for lifxId,name,description.
d073d52cb301,strip,A light strip that is mounted on the back of a projector screen that lights up the wall behind the screen
d073d52df872,backFlood,A flood light in a set of two flood lights that overhang the theater room in front of the projector screen. This light is closer to the exit than the other flood light in the set.
d073d52de938,frontFlood,A flood light in a set of two flood lights that overhang the theater room in front of the projector screen. This light is further away from the exit than the other flood light in the set.
d073d53e1cbb,fireplace,A fairly small spot light shining on the mantle above a fireplace in the corner of the theater room.
d073d53e360a,spotlight1,A small spotlight in a set of two spotlights that shine up the corner wall behind a computer screen. This light is on the right side when facing the computer screen.
d073d572de6f,spotlight2,A small spotlight in a set of two spotlights that shine up the corner wall behind a computer screen. This light is on the left side when facing the computer screen.
d073d53e2d56,aux,An extra powerful desk light that shines down on an auxilliary desk in the office.
d073d5719a96,shower,A light that shines down into the shower in the bathroom.

Here are instructions to create a lighting theme.

On the first line write a 1 or 2 word name for the theme for quick identification. Then, write a line for each light formatted in csv with these fields:
lifxId - string - The id from lifx for the target light.
hue - int - Between 0 and 360, representing the color hue in degree which changes the color.
saturation - int - Between 0 and 100, representing the color intensity from 0% to 100%.
brightness - int - Between 0 and 100, representing the light brightness from 0% to 100%.
kelvin - int - Between 2500 and 9000, representing the color temperature.
duration - int - Fade the color to the new value over time (in milliseconds).

for example
```
Morning Bloom Blues
(light_id), 55, 90, 90, 5500, 500
(light_id), 45, 50, 70, 4500, 500
(light_id), 55, 90, 90, 5500, 500
(light_id), 45, 50, 70, 4500, 500
(light_id), 55, 90, 90, 5500, 500
(light_id), 45, 50, 70, 4500, 500
(light_id), 55, 90, 90, 5500, 500
(light_id), 45, 50, 70, 4500, 500
```

Using 0 for the hue and saturation will result in the light showing as the temperature value. Avoid using neutral tones as this can cause some unanticipated effects.

Generate a lighting theme based on this topic "Boys and Girls".

The theme should include values for each light in this list of ids: d073d52cb301, d073d52df872, d073d52de938, d073d53e1cbb, d073d53e360a, d073d572de6f, d073d53e2d56, d073d5719a96
